results.content:
I now know the basics of plugin development within WordPress. This guy does exactly what he promises to do - take you from zero knowledge of plugin development up to the point of being able to do it on your own. 

I will note - if you don't have any experience with HTML, PHP, or MySQL, this will not be helpful. You definitely need to have working experience with the languages used to follow what is being done in his videos and understand the concepts. There were a couple of points that debugging was needed (not because of his videos), so again, development experience is needed to get the full value from this course.

Overall, I am extremely happy I went through this course, and look forward to implementing the skills I've gained. Thank you!
results.content_html:

results.content: It is a great course, explains how to build a WP plugin (both front-end | back-end) from scratch, using your own db table. The only thing is that it might needed, was a bit more of detailed explanation while writting some parts of the code. If you have some basic experience with PHP you you will love this course.

results.content: This is good kick start course for wordpress plugin development for beginner But not cover all the important things.
results.content_html: This is good kick start course for wordpress plugin development for beginner But not cover all the important things.

results.content:
0 ..... First of all I want to thank Thrandur for this great course that offered me exactly what I was looking for .....

1 ..... This is an example/case based course. It is my strong opinion that such a case/example based course is the best way for acquiring knowlegde and simultaneously being able to put that knowledge immediately (on the spot) into practice .....
2 ..... I already have pretty good knowledge of MYSQL, PHP, HTML and javascript. But programming a wordpress plugin was/is not my cup of tea until now. Focussing on worpress plugins and trying to find out myself how the wordpress plugin concept works, would have taken me at least several days or even 2 weeks.  So this course offered me a "fast lane" to find out within a few hours how interactive wordpress plugins are made and integrated within wordpress .....

3 ..... One small remark: to understand what the various PHP-scripts are doing, and how HTML (client-side) MYSQL (server-side) and PHP (the language between them that makes a plugin do what it has to do) it is recommended to have already some skills and practice in advance in connecting to MYSQL, do a query on MYSQL, and show those results on a webpage.

results.content: This is very useful lecture, instructor have done his homework and there is not even a single second to wait. Everything is ready and no wastage of time in editing uploading etc.
results.content_html: This is very useful lecture, instructor have done his homework and there is not even a single second to wait. Everything is ready and no wastage of time in editing uploading etc.

results.content:
This was a concise course that provided a clear well structured example. I learned several things. Thrandur is not afraid to show errors, which is actually nice because he goes through the trouble shooting which may be very helpful for people who are new to PHP. I'm not sure I would call it a "deep dive" in 2 hours. He didn't touch on object oriented programming which would be a deeper subject.

I went through the class because it was only 2 hours, and I felt like it was worth my time and money.
results.content_html:

results.content:
This is better than the other plugin development course I took. I can develop alongside of the instruction and it makes total sense. So I am quite pleased.

This is a course on developing a plugin. It isn't a course to tell you all the controls you should add in code to assure data validity, etc.

This isn't a complaint, as that level of detail should be in a how to write resilient code course. It is just something that inexperienced developers might need to know lest they think they can publish this level of code for real world use.

One issue I had is that I wasn't able to get the same formatting of the screen using the current bootstrap libraries. I was able to get it when I used the same libraries as the course did.
results.content_html:

results.content: I wish that I had finished this course a couple of months ago. I started it and didn't think that it was a good fit. Now with some extra time, I finished it and found that there was a wealth of information starting with the admin area development. I might suggest that a little time be spent in adding a "Here's what I'm going to show you" , "Here's how to do this (already developed)" , and "Here's what I told you". If I had known where the course was going to take me, I would have finished watching immediately after buying it. Great job!

results.content:
For me it was perfect because I am a relatively experienced developer and I just needed to know the architecture of a wordpress plugin and how it is built, but if I was a beginner with very little knowledge of PHP or programming I am pretty sure that it would have been almost impossible to learn from this course.
So my recommandation is to go for it if you are advanced because it explains the basics of Wordpress plugin development in very little time.
results.content_html:

results.content: This course is sweet, I needed to refresh wordpress plugin development and this is a great starting point. It covers shortcodes and managing additional data stored in custom db tables, it's quick and efficient. Well done, it could be a series actually some other could cover other aspects of plugin development such as using ajax, or custom post type etc. Just a thought for new courses!
results.content_html: This course is sweet, I needed to refresh wordpress plugin development and this is a great starting point. It covers shortcodes and managing additional data stored in custom db tables, it's quick and efficient. Well done, it could be a series actually some other could cover other aspects of plugin development such as using ajax, or custom post type etc. Just a thought for new courses!

results.content: This is what I needed, a short refresher on getting into the PHP code and MySQL (been a long time for me) and concise explanations on WordPress architecture. The simple diagrams of the stack were helpful as was the shortcode section.
results.content_html: This is what I needed, a short refresher on getting into the PHP code and MySQL (been a long time for me) and concise explanations on WordPress architecture. The simple diagrams of the stack were helpful as was the shortcode section.

results.content: The instructor is clearly a master of all of the acronyms in the tag line of this review. But if you are not a master then DO NOT BEGIN HERE. I am a master of several fields and I can feel the thought process of the instructor as he sculpts this masterpiece. But his thought process is way, way above any beginner or intermediate student of web programming. It's like watching Michelangelo sculpt his 'David' and then saying: "OK now to sculpt your own masterpiece just do what I did". This course is very valuable to me because I have mastered most of the tools he uses and I can see what he's doing and where he's going but I have hundreds of hours of study of PHP,CSS,JS,HTML,MySQL and web programming. This course is awesome but it should be labeled 'for experts only'.

results.content: This is a great step by step example of building a simple CRUD plugin from raw HTML/Bootstrap 3.  It is perfect for what I was looking for. That being said I think you'd be less prone to confusion if you have already been exposed to Boostrap 3 and PHP. This not a requirement but if you didn't know how they work you might see things that you think are related to plugins that are just PHP or Bootstrap.  The instructor is great

response.content: Thank for a thoughtful review Jeff!

That being said I think you'd be less prone to confusion if you have already been exposed to Boostrap 3 and PHP. This not a requirement but if you didn't know how they work you might see things that you think are related to plugins that are just PHP or Bootstrap. The instructor is great
